Exciting news! Mount Carmel Area is participating in Pennsylvania's CEP - Community Eligibility Provision. What that means is that all students at Mount Carmel Area will be eligible for free breakfast and lunch beginning this school year!

Please understand that this will include ONE complete meal only. Extras or a la carte items are available for purchase, and will only be allowed if a student has funds in their caf-trac account.

Any questions, please contact Mrs. Lorrie Shearn in the District Office at 570-339-1500, ext. 3121.

Happy Summer everyone!

The MCA Big Red Band will hold its first camp beginning today, Monday June 10, through Wednesday, June 12, from 9 am to 3 pm in the HS Band Room. Lunch will be from 11:30 to 12:30. Any student who is interested in participating in next year's band, or those who think they would like to see what it's all about, should attend. You may attend whether or not you've ever played an instrument before, but we hope everyone who currently plays in band joins us tomorrow. You'll never know if you'll enjoy it unless you give it a try!

Reminder to bring along sneakers and a drink.

There will also be a Band Parent meeting for all members, especially for new members and their parents, on Tuesday, June 11, at 6:30 pm in the Band Room.

Thank you all and we'll see next year's Big Red Band today at 9:00 am!

The Mount Carmel Area High School Jazz Band will present their annual Spring Concert Tuesday, May 28, at 7:00 p.m. in the High School Auditorium.

The band will perform such classics as Glenn Miller’s “In The Mood”, an exciting arrangement of “Faith”, from the movie “Sing”, the Buddy Rich classic “Groovin’ Hard”, and other selections. The program will also feature senior Lexi Leso, Trumpet, playing Larry Neeck’s “After Sunset”.

Special guests for the program will be the Keep Out Brass Band, featuring MCA alumni and alumni of some neighboring schools. These musicians also play in the Knoebel’s Brass Band.

Admission is free for this year's show.

The Mount Carmel Area Concert Band and Wind Ensemble will present their annual Spring Concert on Sunday, May 5, at 3:00 p.m., on the Paul P. Semicek stage in the the Richard F. Beierschmitt Auditorium. The concert will feature as guest trumpet soloists Mount Carmel Area alumni Brian Leslie, Nicole Rosko, and Christopher Stellar, and senior percussionist Joseph Dudeck.

The program will feature senior percussionist Joseph Dudeck, who will perform the xylophone solo “Fluffy Ruffles”. Joseph is a two-time All-State percussionist.

The concert finale will be Leroy Anderson’s “Bugler’s Holiday”, which will feature the trumpet trio of MCA Band Alumni Brian Leslie, Nicole Rosko, and Christopher Stellar. Mr. Leslie is a professional trumpeter and former band staff member, Mrs. Rosko is currently the MCA Elementary Band Director, and Mr. Stellar is a Music Education Major at Bloomsburg University and MCA Band staff member.

Admission to the event is free, but donations to help support the MCA Band program will be accepted at the door.
